bio:
Tedral Mendrin is a Dunmer refugee from Windhelm who now lives in the slums just outside the northern gate of the city of Bruma in Cyrodiil. He doesn't do very much all day. His angry despondency is evident to anyone who encounters him. His shack is full of empty mead bottles.
Tedral usually wears a hat. He carries a dagger on his belt. He knows a few spells, such as Frostbite and Healing.
Here is an example of a potential conversation Balius might have with other residents of the slums:
Tedral: "Look who it is! Blind Balius himself."
Balius: "What do you want now, Tedral?"
Tedral: "Oh, nothing. I just wanted to see you in all your glory."
Balius: "Hmph. Yes, I'm blind and old...but what's your excuse? You're just as bad off as me."
Tedral: "I was attacked by your people, fetcher. One day I might just take up the issue with you."
Balius: "Just leave me be, elf."
Here are some examples of Tedral's potential dialogue towards those who wander into the slums:
"What brings you to our squalor?"
If asked why he lives here in the slums: "I just love the atmosphere. The decaying, rotting wood, the freezing cold, the lice... it's so delightfully rustic..."
"I'm being sarcastic. Seems you have the brainpower of a pony guar. This place is horrible. I'm not here by choice."
"Why am I being sarcastic? Maybe it's because of the wonderfully well-crafted... gah, sorry about the sarcasm. It's just hard to keep my spirits up in this frigid squat. I don't mean to come across badly, I... sorry."
"I got chased out of Skyrim by a mob of angry Windhelm citizens with pitchforks. They called me a 'Witch Elf', a 'dirty grayskin'. Since the Gray Quarter was never particularly homely anyway, I decided I'd leave. I thought people might be a little more tolerant in Cyrodiil. They are, but I don't have the gold for a house. So I sit around, freezing my arse off, in the slums."
name: Tedral Mendrin
